intro: Chylismia claviformis subsp. rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed chylismia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
